title: Personal Portfolio Website
description: Built with Angular standalone components using TypeScript.
Project and experience data is statically defined and rendered at build time, with client-side filtering and expansion logic.
Features dynamic Projects and Experience pages with expandable, responsive cards and image carousels.
Deployed as a static site on GitHub Pages with Git-based version control and CI-driven builds.

title: NAS Build
description: Assembled a home NAS with multiple drives for backups and media storage.
Configured RAID, shared network access, and automated backups.
Learned hands-on networking and Linux system administration.

title: Magic Mirror Build
description: Built a smart mirror using an old TV, Raspberry Pi, poster frame, sheet of glass, and reflective film.
Configured the Magic Mirror software for displaying calendar, weather, and news.
Focused on physical assembly, wiring, and enclosure construction.

title: Insulin Holder
description: Design a safety-focused insulin holder for fridge storage with real temperature awareness.
Use a microcontroller (not a Pi) mounted outside the fridge with a wired probe inside an insulin vial filled with liquid for thermal mass.
Display current temperature locally and send email/SMS alerts if insulin risks freezing or overheating.
Include a pass-through power bank for outage resilience and a dumb thermometer in the holder for redundancy.

title: Raspberry Pi Pen Testing Rig
description: Built a portable pen-testing rig inside an off-brand Pelican case.
Used a Raspberry Pi running Kali Linux for lightweight pentesting tasks.
Included 3D printed mounts and enclosures for components to keep it organized and portable.

title: Home Lab Server Build
description: Rebuilt a server using an old Supermicro X8DTN+ dual processor motherboard.
Installed it in a Fractal Design case with modular PSU and proper cable management.
Configured drives and power distribution for reliable home server operation.
Installed Proxmox VE to run multiple virtual machines, experimenting with virtualization, networking, and containerized workloads.

title: 3D Printed Stool Foot
description: Designed a custom stool foot to replace a missing leg cap.
3D printed it in TPU for flexibility and grip.
Tested fit and durability to ensure stability.

title: LED Drum Kit Lights
description: Built an interactive LED lighting system for marching drums.
Used piezo sensors on each drum to trigger individual LED strips.
Controlled by Arduino for dynamic visual feedback while playing.

title: H2Load HTTP/3 Docker Container
description: Packaged the H2Load HTTP/3 load-testing tool into a lightweight Docker container.
Configured it to run easily on any system with Docker installed, eliminating the need for manual build and dependency setup.
Tested HTTP/3 and HTTP/2 endpoints for performance and stress testing.

title: Walking Pad Accessory Set
description: Designed and modeled a set of 3D-printable accessories for a walking pad, including a laptop stand (x2), mouse pad, and cupholder.
Created a universal back piece to attach all accessories securely to a walking pad bar (~1.6 in Ã— 0.8 in).
Optimized each part for FDM printing in PLA, selecting print orientation, support type, and infill to balance strength and material usage.
Iterated on infill and print settings to improve stiffness and usability of the laptop stands.

title: 3D Printer Closet Environment Monitor
description: Use a Raspberry Pi with an Enviro-style sensor hat to continuously monitor temperature, humidity, and air quality in the 3D printer closet.
Detect abnormal heat buildup, humidity levels that affect filament, and sudden temperature spikes that could indicate fire or enclosure failure.
Provide local status display and remote alerts (email/text) for thermal runaway, ventilation failure, or unsafe conditions.
Log environmental trends to help tune enclosure airflow and filament storage while prioritizing early fire detection.
